title: Kinetic energy - velocity versus time graph

content.question: The graph represents the velocity of an object that is moving through space as a function of time. Which of these statements about the objectâ€™s kinetic energy is true for the time interval shown?

choices.label: The kinetic energy is the same at every point from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 6 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

The kinetic energy is greatest at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math> and decreases as time increases.

The kinetic energy is greatest at <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

The kinetic energy is greatest at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t equals 6 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The kinetic energy is greatest at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t equals 6 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
